tit.cmt: 新規用語統一リストに従い括弧内の補足を追加しました。

sen.j: カツサンドは、カツレツ（主に豚カツや牛カツ）を食パンで挟んだサンドイッチ。
sen.e: Katsusando is a cutlet (usually a pork or beef cutlet) sandwich with white bread.
Katsusando is a cutlet (usually a pork or beef cutlet) sandwich with white bread.
Katsusando is a cutlet (usually a pork or beef cutlet) sandwich with white bread.

sen.j: 「かつサンド」との表記もあるが、どちらの表記を採用するかは、その人・店舗によって様々で、一貫性はない。
sen.e: Although sometimes katsusando is spelled with "katsu" in hiragana and "sando" in katakana, it depends on persons or restaurants which spelling should be used and there is no rule for the spelling.
sen.cmt: 仮名表記は英語ではあまり意味をなしませんが、原文どおり訳しました。
sen.e: Although sometimes katsusando is spelled with "katsu" in hiragana and "sando" in katakana, it depends on persons or restaurants which spelling should be used and there is no rule for the spelling.
Although sometimes katsusando is spelled with "katsu" in hiragana and "sando" in katakana, it depends on persons or restaurants which spelling should be used and there is no rule for the spelling.

sen.j: 以下では「カツサンド」で統一する。
sen.e: In this section, we consistently spell the word in all katakana.
sen.cmt: 上記と同じ理由でこの文章も省略可能ではありますが、原文どおり訳しました。
sen.e: In this section, we consistently spell the word in all katakana.
In this section, we consistently spell the word in all katakana.

tit.cmt: 用語統一リストに従って訂正しました。

sen.j: カツサンドの多くは、食パンで豚カツ・牛カツを挟み、長方形や三角形に切り分けられて供される。
sen.e: Generally, a katsusando, a pork cutlet or a beef cutlet sandwiched with white bread, is served sliced either in rectangular or in triangle.
Generally, a katsusando, a pork cutlet or a beef cutlet sandwiched with white bread, is served sliced either in rectangular or in triangle.
Generally, a katsusando, a pork cutlet or a beef cutlet sandwiched with white bread, is served sliced either in rectangular or in triangle.

sen.j: 豚カツを挟んだものはウスターソースが塗られ、同じ大きさの長方形に切りそろえられているものが多い。
sen.e: A pork cutlet sandwich is served with Worcester sauce and, in many cases, is sliced in the same size rectangular.
A pork cutlet sandwich is served with Worcester sauce and, in many cases, is sliced in the same size rectangular.
A pork cutlet sandwich is served with Worcester sauce and, in many cases, is sliced in the same size rectangular.

sen.j: 一般的なサンドイッチは具に水分が含まれるため、少し乾燥したパンが合うが、カツサンドはカツのサクサクした衣に合う、やわらかいパンが好まれる。
sen.e: While for other types of sandwiches, the ingredients of which are usually moist, dry bread is preferred, in case of katsusando, since the cutlet's breading is crispy, soft bread is better.
While for other types of sandwiches, the ingredients of which are usually moist, dry bread is preferred, in case of katsusando, since the cutlet's breading is crispy, soft bread is better.
While for other types of sandwiches, the ingredients of which are usually moist, dry bread is preferred, in case of katsusando, since the cutlet's breading is crispy, soft bread is better.

sen.j: 他にも多くの形態があり、チキンカツが挟まれているもの、豚カツにからしが塗られているもの、パンと豚カツの間にキャベツが挟まれているものなどがある。
sen.e: There are many other versions: a chicken cutlet sandwich, a pork cutlet with mustard, a pork cutlet with cabbages between a pork cutlet and bread.
There are many other versions: A chicken cutlet sandwich, a pork cutlet with mustard, a pork cutlet with cabbages between a pork cutlet and bread.
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。A大文字にしました。
sen.e: There are many other versions: A chicken cutlet sandwich, a pork cutlet with mustard, a pork cutlet with cabbages between a pork cutlet and bread.

sen.j: 関西では牛カツが主流。
sen.e: The mainstream in the Kansai area is a beef cutlet.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The mainstream in the Kansai area is a beef cutlet.
The mainstream in the Kansai area is a beef cutlet.

sen.j: 豚カツを使ったものは、豚カツサンドと呼称されることも少なくない。
sen.e: The one with a pork cutlet is often called Ton (pork) katsusando.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The one with a pork cutlet is often called Ton (pork) katsusando.
The one with a pork cutlet is often called Ton (pork) katsusando.

sen.j: これは、肉食文化が、関西では牛肉中心、関東では豚肉が中心。
sen.e: Supposedly this reflects the difference of preference of meats between the Kansai area where beef is more regularly eaten and the Kanto area where pork is more common.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Supposedly this reflects the difference of preference of meats between the Kansai area where beef is more regularly eaten and the Kanto area where pork is more common.
Supposedly this reflects the difference of preference of meats between the Kansai area where beef is more regularly eaten and the Kanto area where pork is more common.

sen.j: そして、東京が首都になったため関東の文化が、全国に伝播していったことから来ている差異だと考えられる。
sen.e: And, since Tokyo became the capital of Japan, the Kanto culture spread all over Japan, leading to the different name (for a pork cutlet sandwich.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処カッコ内は原文にはありませんが、あった方がわかりやすいと思い、追加しました。原文の方も「差異」だけでは分かりにくいのでは。
sen.e: And, since Tokyo became the capital of Japan, the Kanto culture spread all over Japan, leading to the different name (for a pork cutlet sandwich.)
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。
sen.e: And, since Tokyo became the capital of Japan, the Kanto culture spread all over Japan, leading to the different name (for a pork cutlet sandwich.)

sen.j: 名古屋市とその周辺では普通の「ソースカツサンド」の他、「味噌カツサンド」がコンビニなどで販売されている。
sen.e: In Nagoya City and its vicinity, besides a regular "sauce katsusando," a "miso katsusando" is sold at convenience stores and so on.
In Nagoya City and its vicinity, besides a regular 'sauce katsusando,' a 'miso katsusando' is sold at convenience stores and so on.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。
sen.e: In Nagoya City and its vicinity, besides a regular 'sauce katsusando,' a 'miso katsusando' is sold at convenience stores and so on.

sen.j: なおアメリカ合衆国では、インディアナ州の名物として、豚ヒレ肉のフライがハンバーガーバンズに挟まれた形式のサンドウィッチが存在する。
sen.e: In the United States, Indiana boasts a deep fried pork tenderloin sandwich with buns as its speciality.
In the United States, Indiana boasts a deep fried pork tenderloin sandwich with buns as its specialty.
In the United States, Indiana boasts a deep fried pork tenderloin sandwich with buns as its specialty.
